essential-container.msg: ⚠️ Essential Mod Not Supported We strongly recommend against using Essential ($JAR_NAME$) with this modpack. A free world-sharing alternative is already built-in using e4mc - click Share World in the game menu. Why we don't support Essential: • Technical issues: We've received multiple user reports of problems when combining Essential with our modpacks, including reports of world corruption. While there is no conclusive evidence of Essential as the definite cause, we do not have the development or support capacity to resolve issues potentially caused by it. • Security concerns: Essential's auto-updater introduces potential security risks that are outside of our control. • Ethics: We object to Essential's inclusion of in-game currency and microtransactions in an otherwise free modding environment. If you choose to use Essential anyway, please understand that you do so at your own risk and will not be eligible for support from our team. To remove this warning, you can open your modpack instance folder, navigate to config/crash_assistant/problematic_mods_config.json, and under essential-container, change should_crash_on_startup from true to false.

e4mc_minecraft.msg: ⚠️ Duplicate e4mc Mod Detected You have manually added the e4mc mod ($JAR_NAME$) to the modpack. This is not needed, as all Luna Pixel Studios modpacks already include our custom fork of e4mc by default with built-in world sharing functionality. Why this causes issues: • Having both versions installed can cause conflicts and unexpected behavior • Our custom fork includes optimizations and fixes specific to our modpacks Recommended action: Remove the manually added e4mc mod from your mods folder. Alternative: If you are having issues with our built-in world sharing, hosting a server on your own PC via the serverpack is easy. Learn more here: https://github.com/chorbintime/LPS-readme/wiki If you still want to proceed with the duplicate mod, please understand that you do so at your own risk and will not be eligible for support from our team. To remove this warning, open your modpack instance folder, navigate to config/crash_assistant/problematic_mods_config.json, and under e4mc_minecraft, change should_crash_on_startup from true to false.

tlskincape.msg: It appears that you are using TLauncher, a launcher likely to be infected with spyware that could steal your passwords and monitor your computer activity. TLauncher also does not install modpacks correctly, which results in many missing files that will potentially break the modpack. It is heavily encouraged to delete all traces of TLauncher off of your computer, do an antivirus scan, and buy Minecraft so you can use a better launcher, such as https://atlauncher.com/downloads.

despawn_tweaker.msg: If you are seeing this, you have manually added the Despawn Tweaker mod to the modpack. The Despawn Tweaker mod is not needed, as a better mod with similar functionality (Despawn Tweaks) is already present in the modpack.

doespotatotick.msg: If you are seeing this, you have manually added the DoesPotatoTick mod to the modpack. The DoesPotatoTick mod is not needed, as a better mod with similar functionality (Does It Tick) is already present in the modpack.

dynamiclights.msg: If you are seeing this, you have manually added the Dynamic Lights mod to the modpack. The Dynamic Lights mod is not needed, as a better mod with similar functionality (either Sodium/Embeddium Dynamic Lights or LambDynamicLights) is already present in the modpack.

epicfight.msg: ⚠️ Epic Fight Mod Not Supported You have manually added the Epic Fight mod ($JAR_NAME$) to the modpack. We strongly recommend against using this mod. Why we don't support Epic Fight: • Stability issues: Epic Fight is known to cause frequent crashes and game-breaking bugs • Compatibility problems: Epic Fight has widespread incompatibilities with many mods commonly found in modpacks • Support limitations: We do not have the development capacity to troubleshoot issues caused by Epic Fight's extensive modifications Recommended alternative: If you would like a more stable combat overhaul, consider using the Better Combat mod instead. If you choose to use Epic Fight anyway, please understand that you do so at your own risk and will not be eligible for support from our team. To remove this warning, open your modpack instance folder, navigate to config/crash_assistant/problematic_mods_config.json, and under epicfight, change should_crash_on_startup from true to false.

valkyrienskies.msg: ⚠️ Valkyrien Skies Not Supported You have manually added the Valkyrien Skies mod ($JAR_NAME$) to the modpack. We strongly recommend against using this mod with pre-existing modpacks. Why we don't support Valkyrien Skies: • Compatibility issues: Valkyrien Skies makes fundamental changes to physics and world handling that conflict with many other mods • Integration requirements: Valkyrien Skies requires careful modpack design and testing from the ground up to work properly • Technical limitations: Adding Valkyrien Skies to an existing modpack that wasn't designed for it typically results in crashes, world corruption, and unpredictable behavior If you choose to use Valkyrien Skies anyway, please understand that you do so at your own risk and will not be eligible for support from our team. To remove this warning, open your modpack instance folder, navigate to config/crash_assistant/problematic_mods_config.json, and under valkyrienskies, change should_crash_on_startup from true to false.

optifine.msg: ⚠️ OptiFine Not Compatible You have manually added the OptiFine mod ($JAR_NAME$) to the modpack. Why OptiFine doesn't work with this pack: • Compatibility issues: OptiFine is closed-source and makes extensive, undocumented changes to Minecraft's rendering code, causing conflicts with many mods in this pack • Better alternatives included: Modern optimization and shader mods (Sodium/Xenon and Iris/Oculus) are already present in this modpack and provide superior performance with full mod compatibility Recommended action: Remove OptiFine from your mods folder.
